description:
An introduction to the study of music, necessary for
success as a music student and professional
musician in the 21st century.

Focusing on research, communication and critical
thinking, students will acquire a shared vocabulary to
talk and write about music, and an understanding of
musical concepts and genres.

Students will also study music as a cultural and
social phenomenon and contrast historical and
present performance practice, with emphasis on
works currently being performed in the Conservatory.
Students will develop confidence in expressing their
own artistic perspectives and evaluate what it means
to be part of an evolving musical ecosystem.
title: Foundations for Musical Discovery
